channel.title: Authors on IM
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on IM

item.description:
Welcome! I am a PhD Cand. in Political Science at the University of Pittsburgh. My research interests are broadly in international political economy and political behavior.

My dissertation analyzes how public support for free trade evolves over time and the conditions under which policymakers adjust trade policy to voters’ preferences in developing democracies. My research agenda also includes work on the political economy of sovereign debt, international financial institutions, and intergovernmental transfers.

I am a native of Argentina, where I lectured in Comparative Politics, Latin American Politics, and Research Methods, as well as served as a policy analyst in Congress and the Government of Buenos Aires.
